docket.docket_text: COMPLAINT. Filing fee received: $ 400.00, receipt number 0970-15648287 filed by Crystal Begody. (Harper, Kevin) (DLC) (Entered: 06/22/2018)

Filing fee paid, receipt number 0970-15648287. This case has been assigned to the Honorable Roslyn O Silver. All future pleadings or documents should bear the correct case number: CV-18-01973-PHX-ROS. Notice of Availability of Magistrate Judge to Exercise Jurisdiction form attached. (DLC) (Entered: 06/22/2018)

NOTICE TO THE PARTIES - The Court is participating in the Mandatory Initial Discovery Pilot (MIDP) and this case is subject to that pilot. The key features and deadlines are set forth in the attached Notice which includes General Order 17-08. Also attached is a checklist for use by the parties. All parties must respond to the mandatory initial discovery requests set forth in the General Order before initiating any further discovery in this case. Please note: The discovery obligations in the General Order supersede the disclosures required by Rule 26(a)(1). Any party seeking affirmative relief must serve a copy of the attached documents (Notice to Parties, including General Order 17-08 and MIDP Checklist) on each new party when the Complaint, Counterclaim, Crossclaim, or Third-Party Complaint is served. (DLC) (Entered: 06/22/2018)

NOTICE TO FILER OF DEFICIENCY re: 1 Complaint filed by Crystal Begody. Pursuant to the Electronic Case Filing Administrative Policies and Procedures Manual Section II(B), attorneys are required to submit the automated Civil Cover Sheet when filing a new case. FOLLOW-UP ACTION REQUIRED: Please file the document. Deficiency must be corrected within one business day of this notice. This is a TEXT ENTRY ONLY. There is no PDF document associated with this entry. (DLC) (Entered: 06/22/2018)

STIPULATION FOR EXTENSION OF TIME TO ANSWER COMPLAINT by Crystal Begody. (Attachments: # 1 Text of Proposed Order)(Harper, Kevin) (Entered: 08/27/2018)

ORDER granting a one-time extension of time until 9/14/2018 to respond to complaint. The parties' obligations to produce the information called for in the MIDP will be triggered by Defendant's answer to the complaint after the extension. The parties should be aware that the filing of a motion to dismiss under Rule 12(b)(6) will not postpone the time for compliance with the MIDP. General Order 17-08 provides that compliance may be deferred only for motions to dismiss based on lack of subject-matter jurisdiction, lack of personal jurisdiction, sovereign immunity, or absolute or qualified immunity of a public official. No further extensions will be granted. Signed by Senior Judge David G Campbell on 9/10/2018. This is a TEXT ENTRY ONLY. There is no PDF document associated with this entry. (DGC, nvo) (Entered: 09/10/2018)

ORDER. Rule 16 Case Management Conference set for 11/8/2018 at 04:30 PM in Courtroom 603, 401 West Washington Street, Phoenix, AZ 85003 before Senior Judge David G Campbell. Signed by Senior Judge David G Campbell on 9/10/2018. (DGC, nvo) (Entered: 09/10/2018)
NOTICE of Settlement by Crystal Begody. (Harper, Kevin) (Entered: 09/14/2018)

ORDER: The Court has been advised that this case has settled 15 . IT IS ORDERED that this matter will, without further Order of this Court, be dismissed with prejudice within 30 days of the date of this order unless a stipulation to dismiss is filed prior to the dismissal date. All pending hearings and deadlines are vacated. All pending motions are found to be moot. The Clerk is directed to terminate this matter on October 18, 2018 without further leave of Court. Signed by Senior Judge David G Campbell on 9/18/2018. (REK) (Entered: 09/19/2018)
MINUTE ORDER: Pursuant to 16 , Civil Case Terminated. This is a TEXT ENTRY ONLY. There is no PDF document associated with this entry. (ATD) (Entered: 10/19/2018)
